nodes.text: Quay was the name of one of Sriluur's moons. As such it became the name for the Moon God and chief deity of the Weequay religion. The word "Weequay" meant "Followers of Quay". The Month of Plenty was a holiday devoted to Quay.

At least some Weequay took to worshiping a child's toy which generated random answers to questions posed to it, simply on the grounds that it was small, round and white and bore a passing resemblance to the moon.
